title: Jennifer Lopez interview chaos as her cookie wasn't warmed to right temperature

Jennifer Lopez demanded a cookie warmed to the perfect temperature ahead of an interview for This Morning.

The Hollywood actress and singer, who is celebrating her 50th birthday, shared her style secrets with viewers of the show.

But presenter Phillip Schofield revealed there was one secret that J. Lo failed to mention on camera.

The mum-of-two made a bizarre demand on her rider that caused "quite a commotion" behind-the-scenes.

Phil said: "One secret J. Lo didn’t mention was her love for milk and cookies."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Holly added: "More specifically a cookie warmed to the perfect temperature with a glass of full fat milk, cold."

The actress' team insisted that they should have the milk and perfectly warmed cookie waiting for her on arrival.

Phillip revealed: "There was quite a commotion when they worried the cookie wasn’t the right temperature. If you want Jennifer’s real secret to looking fabulous at 50, this is it."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The presenters had there own milk and cookies on set - but admitted they didn't know if the snack as the right temperature.

"It's gooey and I'm not complaining," confessed Holly as they tucked into the cookies.

But Phil had a complaint of his own as he realised the milk was not cold and jokingly turned into a diva.

He said: "She has ordinary milk and for some strange reason I’ve got hot milk. And I can’t do hot milk. this is filthy. I can’t be doing that."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

This came after J. Lo revealed some of her top tips for looking younger afterher 50th birthday.

The fashion icon, who is launching her own perfume, said: "Honestly I'm just consistent with trying to take care of myself.

:To work out even when I don't want to three of four times a week for an hour. try to get good sleep. Try to have balance.

"It's not always easy. I have kids. I’m in a relationship. Sometimes I feel overwhelmed juggling all the things I'm doing but I think I’m doing okay."

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby disclosed the Hollywood star's bizarre demand that caused 'quite a commotion'
